The category of abelian groups is abelian.

type: CategoryTheory.Abelian AddCommGrp
name: AddCommGrp.instAbelian
docString: The category of abelian groups is abelian.

If a property holds for every coset representative of an additive subgroup of an abelian group, then it holds for all elements in the quotient group.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : AddGroup α] {s : AddSubgroup α} {C : α ⧸ s → Prop} (x : α ⧸ s), (∀ (z : α), C ↑z) → C x
name: QuotientAddGroup.induction_on
docString: If a property holds for every coset representative of an additive subgroup of an abelian group, then it holds for all elements in the quotient group.

The theorem `Abelianization.hom_ext` states that for any group `G` and any monoid `A`, if two monoid morphisms `φ` and `ψ` from the abelianization of `G` to `A` are such that their compositions with the canonical projection from `G` to its abelianization are equal, then the two morphisms `φ` and `ψ` themselves are equal. In other words, it provides a criterion for the equality of morphisms from the abelianization of a group to a monoid in terms of their compositions with the canonical projection.

type:
∀ {G : Type u} [inst : Group G] {A : Type v} [inst_1 : Monoid A] (φ ψ : Abelianization G →* A),
  φ.comp Abelianization.of = ψ.comp Abelianization.of → φ = ψ
name: Abelianization.hom_ext
docString: The theorem `Abelianization.hom_ext` states that for any group `G` and any monoid `A`, if two monoid morphisms `φ` and `ψ` from the abelianization of `G` to `A` are such that their compositions with the canonical projection from `G` to its abelianization are equal, then the two morphisms `φ` and `ψ` themselves are equal. In other words, it provides a criterion for the equality of morphisms from the abelianization of a group to a monoid in terms of their compositions with the canonical projection.

An Abelian group is equivalent to its own abelianization.

type: {H : Type u_1} → [inst : CommGroup H] → H ≃* Abelianization H
name: Abelianization.equivOfComm
docString: An Abelian group is equivalent to its own abelianization.

Every finitely generated abelian group is isomorphic to the direct product of a free abelian group and a finite direct sum of cyclic groups of prime power order.

type:
∀ (G : Type u) [inst : AddCommGroup G] [hG : AddGroup.FG G],
  ∃ n ι x p, ∃ (_ : ∀ (i : ι), (p i).Prime), ∃ e, Nonempty (G ≃+ (Fin n →₀ ℤ) × DirectSum ι fun i => ZMod (p i ^ e i))
name: AddCommGroup.equiv_free_prod_directSum_zmod
docString: Every finitely generated abelian group is isomorphic to the direct product of a free abelian group and a finite direct sum of cyclic groups of prime power order.

This theorem states that, for any abelian group (G), the torsion submonoid of G is equal to the torsion subgroup of G when viewed as a submonoid. In other words, the collection of elements of G with finite order, when considered under the operations of the group (which includes inversion), forms a subgroup that coincides with the submonoid formed by considering only the monoid operations (without inversion).

type: ∀ (G : Type u_1) [inst : CommGroup G], CommMonoid.torsion G = (CommGroup.torsion G).toSubmonoid
name: CommGroup.torsion_eq_torsion_submonoid
docString: This theorem states that, for any abelian group (G), the torsion submonoid of G is equal to the torsion subgroup of G when viewed as a submonoid. In other words, the collection of elements of G with finite order, when considered under the operations of the group (which includes inversion), forms a subgroup that coincides with the submonoid formed by considering only the monoid operations (without inversion).

Any group of exponent two is abelian.

type: {G : Type u} → [inst : Group G] → Monoid.exponent G = 2 → CommGroup G
name: instCommGroupOfExponentTwo
docString: Any group of exponent two is abelian.

Abelian groups are nilpotent

type: ∀ {G : Type u_2} [inst : CommGroup G], Group.IsNilpotent G
name: CommGroup.isNilpotent
docString: Abelian groups are nilpotent

Groups with nilpotency class at most one are abelian

type: {G : Type u_1} → [inst : Group G] → [inst_1 : Group.IsNilpotent G] → Group.nilpotencyClass G ≤ 1 → CommGroup G
name: commGroupOfNilpotencyClass
docString: Groups with nilpotency class at most one are abelian

The free abelian group on a type.

type: Type u → Type u
name: FreeAbelianGroup
docString: The free abelian group on a type.

Abelian groups have nilpotency class at most one

type: ∀ {G : Type u_2} [inst : CommGroup G], Group.nilpotencyClass G ≤ 1
name: CommGroup.nilpotencyClass_le_one
docString: Abelian groups have nilpotency class at most one

Equivalent groups have equivalent abelianizations

type: {G : Type u} → [inst : Group G] → {H : Type v} → [inst_1 : Group H] → G ≃* H → Abelianization G ≃* Abelianization H
name: MulEquiv.abelianizationCongr
docString: Equivalent groups have equivalent abelianizations

In the category of abelian groups, every monomorphism is normal.

type: {X Y : AddCommGrp} → (f : X ⟶ Y) → CategoryTheory.Mono f → CategoryTheory.NormalMono f
name: AddCommGrp.normalMono
docString: In the category of abelian groups, every monomorphism is normal.

In the category of abelian groups, every epimorphism is normal.

type: {X Y : AddCommGrp} → (f : X ⟶ Y) → CategoryTheory.Epi f → CategoryTheory.NormalEpi f
name: AddCommGrp.normalEpi
docString: In the category of abelian groups, every epimorphism is normal.

Any additive group of exponent two is abelian.

type: {G : Type u} → [inst : AddGroup G] → AddMonoid.exponent G = 2 → AddCommGroup G
name: instAddCommGroupOfExponentTwo
docString: Any additive group of exponent two is abelian.

The free condensed abelian group on a finite set.

type: (R : Type (u + 1)) → [inst : Ring R] → CategoryTheory.Functor FintypeCat (CondensedMod R)
name: Condensed.finFree
docString: The free condensed abelian group on a finite set.

Every abelian category is, in particular, `NonPreadditiveAbelian`.

type:
{C : Type u} →
  [inst : CategoryTheory.Category.{v, u} C] →
    [inst_1 : CategoryTheory.Abelian C] → CategoryTheory.NonPreadditiveAbelian C
name: CategoryTheory.Abelian.nonPreadditiveAbelian
docString: Every abelian category is, in particular, `NonPreadditiveAbelian`.

The free-forgetful adjunction for abelian groups.

type: AddCommGrp.free ⊣ CategoryTheory.forget AddCommGrp
name: AddCommGrp.adj
docString: The free-forgetful adjunction for abelian groups.

Isomorphic types have isomorphic free abelian groups.

type: {α : Type u_1} → {β : Type u_2} → α ≃ β → FreeAbelianGroup α ≃+ FreeAbelianGroup β
name: FreeAbelianGroup.equivOfEquiv
docString: Isomorphic types have isomorphic free abelian groups.

The abelianization of G is the quotient of G by its commutator subgroup.

type: (G : Type u) → [inst : Group G] → Type u
name: Abelianization
docString: The abelianization of G is the quotient of G by its commutator subgroup.

An abelian Lie algebra with trivial radical is trivial.

type:
∀ (R : Type u_1) (L : Type u_2) [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : LieRing L] [inst_2 : LieAlgebra R L]
  [inst : LieAlgebra.HasTrivialRadical R L] [h : IsLieAbelian L], Subsingleton L
name: LieAlgebra.subsingleton_of_hasTrivialRadical_lie_abelian
docString: An abelian Lie algebra with trivial radical is trivial.

The free abelian group on a type with one term is isomorphic to `ℤ`.

type: (T : Type u_1) → [inst : Unique T] → FreeAbelianGroup T ≃+ ℤ
name: FreeAbelianGroup.punitEquiv
docString: The free abelian group on a type with one term is isomorphic to `ℤ`.

The abelianization functor `Group ⥤ CommGroup` sending a group `G` to its abelianization `Gᵃᵇ`.

type: CategoryTheory.Functor Grp CommGrp
name: Grp.abelianize
docString: The abelianization functor `Group ⥤ CommGroup` sending a group `G` to its abelianization `Gᵃᵇ`.

The abelianization-forgetful adjuction from `Group` to `CommGroup`.

type: Grp.abelianize ⊣ CategoryTheory.forget₂ CommGrp Grp
name: Grp.abelianizeAdj
docString: The abelianization-forgetful adjuction from `Group` to `CommGroup`.
